timeline.message:
Implement Validator API GetAggregate method

https://ethereum.github.io/eth2.0-APIs/#/Validator/getAggregatedAttestation
Signed-off-by: Lucas Saldanha <lucascrsaldanha@gmail.com>

Adding test for method route

Signed-off-by: Lucas Saldanha <lucascrsaldanha@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Ooo, that's a terrible abuse of the 403 response code. Good luck to anyone wanting to implement authenticated REST APIs and trying to distinguish between needing to authenticate and not being subscribed to the topic. On the plus side we're not actually performing the check so won't affect us.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, it might be worth raising it on the spec repo. But you are right, atm we aren't enforcing it so it should be fine.
This is likely to change as the spec evolves, so we don't have to worry too much about it.
replies.author: lucassaldanha

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/data/beaconrestapi/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/beaconrestapi/handlers/validator/GetAggregate.java b/data/beaconrestapi/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/beaconrestapi/handlers/validator/GetAggregate.java
index 11db0b80b1..872c3aa593 100644
--- a/data/beaconrestapi/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/beaconrestapi/handlers/validator/GetAggregate.java
+++ b/data/beaconrestapi/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/beaconrestapi/handlers/validator/GetAggregate.java

@@ -69,7 +69,7 @@ public class GetAggregate implements Handler {
         @OpenApiParam(
             name = ATTESTATION_DATA_ROOT,
             description =
-                "`String` HashTreeRoot of AttestationData that validator want's aggregated.",
+                "`String` HashTreeRoot of AttestationData that validator wants aggregated.",
             required = true),
         @OpenApiParam(
             name = SLOT,
